title: When is it better to use 4G over 5G? - Quora

response.answer_text: 5G isn't going to be around for a few more years, 4G IMO is good enough for everything I need to do. Play games, download stuff, call, send messages, watch videos, just about anything you want to do that requires some sort of connection, 4G is good enough for. I think the development of 5G would more give technology companies a bigger advantage when it comes to self automated tasks, in facilities, or out in public. I don’t think an average consumer would be able to use 5G to its full capabilities. Companies like Baidu, who are creating self automated taxis, are using 5G to their advantage so that it makes it safe for the passenger, and those around them.

A strong 4G signal beats a weak or oversubscribed 5G signal. I have worked in areas where I would have paid dearly for a good 2G signal. If all things were equal and I had a choice, which I don’t because my handset auto negotiates, I would prefer 5G to stream video and download files.
